WYSIWYM.model
Class QueryValueNode

java.lang.Object
  WYSIWYM.model.Node
      WYSIWYM.model.SGNode
          WYSIWYM.model.QueryNode
              WYSIWYM.model.QueryValueNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable, DatatypeNode, TreeComponent
public class QueryValueNode
extends QueryNode
implements DatatypeNode

QueryValueNode is a node in the QueryGraph that contains a datatype value. This value is presented in a QueryValue, which either contains the datatype and a numeric comparator (>, <, =, 'during'), or a list of query-values with a boolean operator. CURRENTLY QUERYVALUENODE ASSUMES THAT A QUERYVALUE HAS ONLY ONE LAYER OF CHILDREN; MEANING, THAT ALL ITS CHILDREN CONTAIN A DATATYPE!

Version:
1.2 08-02-2008
Author:
Feikje Hielkema

Constructor Detail

QueryValueNode

public QueryValueNode()
Default constructor, constructs a node with the default label

QueryValueNode

public QueryValueNode(int op)
Constructs a node with the default label and the given operator. The default value of the operator is -1; value can be set to 0 = conjunction (and), 1 = disjunction (or), 2 = negation (not).

Parameters:
op - int between 0 and 2

add

public void add(SGNode n,
                int comp)
Adds a QueryValue with the given node and numeric comparator. The comparator states how a resource description's value should match the requirement; @see #EQUAL, @see #LESS, @see #MORE, @see #DURING.

Parameters:
n - SGNode
comp - Numeric comparator, int between 0 and 3.

getOperatorNL

public String getOperatorNL(boolean any)
Returns the nl-representation of the numeric comparator.

Parameters:
any - If true, returns for number values with the boolean operator 'not' 'a number that is not exactly ..' rather than 'not ...'. Implemented to improve the realisation of 'any property' ('is related to not 20' sounds dreadful)
Returns:
String
